ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin contemporarius, formed from con- (together) + tempus, tempor- (time).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Belonging to or occurring in the present time; modern.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 属于或发生于目前时代；现代的；当代的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The museum is exhibiting a new collection of contemporary art.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该博物馆正在展出新的当代艺术收藏品。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Existing or occurring during the same period of time as someone or something else.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与某人或某物处于同一时期或年代的；同代的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The invention of the printing press was contemporary with the start of the Renaissance.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 印刷机的发明与文艺复兴的开始是同时代的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun (a person, place, thing, or idea)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person of the same age or period as another.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was considered one of the greatest singers among her contemporaries.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她被认为是同时代人中最伟大的歌手之一。

REGISTER: Neutral to Formal (frequently used in art, architecture, and historical contexts)
